summary: Email correspondence from July 2021 between an Assistant U.S. Attorney and FedEx legal department regarding obtaining a records custodian to sign an affidavit or testify at the upcoming Ghislaine Maxwell trial. The discussion involves FedEx records related to a subpoena from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida in February 2008.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the upcoming criminal trial in New York scheduled for November 2021, for which the email correspondence is seeking FedEx records and testimony.

persons.name: Tracy Chapel
persons.context: FedEx legal department employee who is being contacted regarding records and potential testimony for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Trial Scheduled
events.description: The criminal trial for Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled to start in New York in November 2021.

events.title: Subpoena to FedEx from SD Florida
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida sent a subpoena to FedEx in February 2008, referenced in the context of obtaining records for the Maxwell trial.

keyFacts: Prosecutors in the Ghislaine Maxwell case were seeking a FedEx records custodian in July 2021 to sign an affidavit or testify at trial regarding records from 2008.
A subpoena was issued to FedEx by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida in February 2008, indicating earlier investigative activity related to the Epstein/Maxwell case.
The email chain shows coordination between law enforcement and corporate legal departments to secure evidence for the high-profile trial.
The correspondence is external and includes a caution about external email origins, indicating standard security protocols for sensitive legal communications.
